fields.summary: Add a "report as spam" feature for comments

fields.description:
We need a mass copy action.
We like to select a couple of tickets and to copy them to a knew project/version, because there are revolving tasks, which are not suited to be integrated into a workflow.
A Screenshot of the user screen, where it could be implemented is attached.
fields.summary: Mass Action "Copy"

fields.description:
When disabling plugins, it is possible to disable a plugin which then renders jira incapable of restarting.

This can be manifested by disabling the fisheye plugins relating to perforce and leaving the other fisheye plugins enabled and trying to restart jira.  It will lead to jira failing due to not being able to find an appropriate constructor to create the plugin Component.

Jira should not allow the disabling of plugins that would render the system incapable of restarting...
fields.summary: It is possible to disable plugins that then render jira incapable of restarting

fields.description:
The AssigneeSystemField is use the getAssigneeId() method incorrectly as the assignee name.  It should use getAssignee().

The user authentication system is then asked for the user "unassigned" which is in fact coming from Lucene as a place holder value.
fields.summary: JIRA is asking Crowd for a user called "unassigned".

fields.description:
Currently when you search by a cascading select field it is slow and inefficient.  This is because CascadingSelectSearcher does not implement SortableCustomFieldSearcher.  We were aware of this, so there could be a reason why it doesn't...  this has the effect of reading every customfield value for every issue in the search into memory.  Not good.

This caused a big customer to run out of memory.
fields.summary: CascadingSelectSearcher does not implement SortableCustomFieldSearcher and is really inefficent (cpu and memory)

fields.description:
I have attached an image (001.png) showing the precise issue.

The Publish Draft Workflow screen is very confusing. Specifically, the phrase "Are you sure you want to continue?" is superflous to the screen. There's no option of me to say Yes or No. The Yes/No option that is displayed governs whether the draft workflow is saved as a copy, or overwrites the existing workflow.

Surely the phrases on this screen can be worded better...
fields.summary: Publish Draft Workflow screen contains very confusing text.

fields.description:
To reproduce, open Jira in two browser windows.  In the first, navigate to an issue with an available workflow action.  In the second, log out.  In the first, perform one of the workflow actions. 

You'll see a page asking you to log back in, but the action has still been performed.  To see this, in the second window, log back in. 
Navigate to the issue in either window.  You'll see that the action has been performed.
fields.summary: It's possible to execute a workflow action without being logged in.

fields.description:
Using a calendar for introducing the time.
Rather than going issue by issue to enter the time, we can use a calendar to insert the time.
fields.summary: Using a calendar for introducing the time.

Follow this structure is important for agile planning.
fields.summary: Inheritance releases (sub-releases)

fields.description:
{quote}While browsing documentation to activate Jelly Tags and following links I hit the following page:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12.3/runasservice.html

And the documentation suggest to execute the following sentence:

tomcat5 //US//JIRA ++JvmOptions="-Djira.jelly.on=true"

It not works and I found that, in our installation, we have to run the sentence:

tomcat5 //US//JIRA120908130533 ++JvmOptions="-Djira.jelly.on=true"{quote}

The documentation should read {{tomcat5 //US//<service_name> ++JvmOptions="-Djira.jelly.on=true"
fields.summary: Documentation mistake

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently there is a documentation on jira website to modity email content :

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+Custom+Fields+to+Email

However there is no way to modify email subject. 

It could be usefull if the subject could be parameterized.

In our case, we had the standard subject  :

(issue action) : (issue name) (issue summary)

but we modified MailingListCompiler.java to have :

(issue name) (issue summary): (issue action)

Users in our company prefers that way as it is more easy to sort their emails by subject and group every mail related to a specific issue. 

We just modified the file : MaillingListCompiler.java

line 323 :
< return translatedSubject + ": " + emailSubject.getSubjectTrailer();
> return emailSubject.getSubjectTrailer() + ": " + translatedSubject ;

It is an ugly hack for our need but I think it could improve the usability if this things could be modified in administration or user preferences.
fields.summary: Allow parameterization of email subjects
Allow editing workflow drafts in XML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15593].
  {panel}

If possible, I'd like a field where you can create/select customers for the specific issue.

Not like the select-fields where you must be the administrator to create values for the selectbox.

Maybe a multiline-box for the values, where the first line is the companyname, and the rest of the lines are contactinformation.

And while selecting the company, it should be either a dropdown/select-field or an ajax-like textbox (like the user-fields)

That's one of the things we're missing in this system. :) We can manage without it, but it would be great to be able to link our issues to customers in an easy way.

fields.description:
We regularly receive support cases in which the root cause is a database connection closure. Whenever we receive such a case, we refer the customer to the [Surviving Connection Closures|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Surviving+Connection+Closures] documentation, and ask them to add the validation query.

As this type of problem could have consequences to the data integrity of Jira, I was wondering if we should recommend that setting in the standard database configuration, like in: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/mysql.html

Of course, running the validation query may have a performance impact, specially for environments where the is a high network latency. It would be good to know how regularly this query is run (once every time we request a connection from the pool? once before every SQL command?) and how it impacts Jira. Maybe with that information we could make a decision on whether all customers should set that type of validation.
fields.summary: Surviving connection closures by default

<script type="text/javascript" src="/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:yui/dom.js" ></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="/jira/s/330/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:yui/event.js" ></script>

fields.description:
JIRA 3.13 added new "finger print" handling to the mail service code.

The idea was that if JIRA has had its "fingers on an email before" then we dont want to continue to handle the message.

HOWEVER in doing this we have also change the default behaviour of the "deleteEmail" flag.  It nows will delete an email by default unless told other wise

This might not be a wise choice as proven by JRA-15550

Also its possible not to have any finger prints on an email and still the default "delete" behaviour

We need to review again the intention of the finger print code and possible change the default "delete" back to false unless we are really sure.

This issue is a placeholder issue to perform that work and ensure email handling is still rock solid

fields.description: Some javascript which lives in jira-global.js attempts to keep track of the position of popup windows and store coordinates and size of th epopup in a cookie. Opened windows (which are typically done as window.open without any top / left coordinates) will continue to travel in a diagonal direction until they are out of view of the window. This is quite annoying to the user.

fields.description:
Whatever a customer asks the magic approach is to create issues. In further discussions the unique references of the issues can be used which allow to define the work and to make abstraction of the more technical content of the work to be done.

Versioning is very well done inside Jira but is missing some functionality that issues have.
# a unique number 
# history
# ...

Often versions are discussed with customers because they are created to indicate a bunch of issues under analysis, for prioritisation and to indicate exact version numbers of implementation. Discussing a version is a lot easier than discussing every issue. Withing this use case versions change names are moved around and what is missing is a trace of all these activities.

Issuefying a version can solve this.

Imagine a version with <projectkey>-<unique number> that changes name from "To be planned" to "Version x.y". For that reference we could trace every change and communicate to every body the non-changed reference number. 
A version would a special instance of an issue.

This approach could also satisfy: JRA-14229, JRA-3157, ...

I can imagine the same functionality be implemented for components also.
fields.summary: Version improvement.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15553].
  {panel}

As noted in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-27005, the single biggest performance issue when scaling Jira to a large number of issues comes from inefficient date sorting performance in Lucene.

The strategy to solving this is essentially the same strategy described in JRA-15549.  Upon any change to an issue, a new Lucene IndexReader/Searcher object should be generated in the background and "pre-warmed" by doing any search that triggers a sort on a date field.  Once the object is ready, the active object should be swapped out for the newly generated one.

There is a trade-off here in that search results could potentially be a few seconds out-of-date, but interactive performance of searches that sort on dates should be greatly improved.

It is possible that JRA-15517 *might* make this feature unnecessary, but I won't be able to report on that until Jira 4.0 is released.
fields.summary: Implement Lucene IndexReader/Searcher queue

fields.description:
The "Assign Users to Project Role" screen does not check whether the project still exists. In a multi-tab browser, if a user deletes the project in one tab and assigns the user to a project role in another tab for the same project, it does not give warning. Moreover, it makes all projects created afterwards have that user in that project role.

Steps to reproduce:
    * From the View project screen (where you can delete project), open "Project role: View members" link in new tab. Click edit users of a project role (e.g., Developer).
    * Delete the project with the View project screen
    * In the "Assign Users to Project Role: Developer" screen, add an arbitrary user to project role. There is no warning/error that project has been deleted.
    * Create a new project. Check the project role members. The user is already a member even though the project is newly created.

The problem is that the UserRoleActorAction is re-used for setting both a project's role actors as well as the default role actors.  If getProject() == null then it will add the user to the default project roles, which can be the case if an projectId was used of a deleted project.  To fix this we should either:
* Fix up the logic in the action such that we only update the default roles if the projectId was null.  If the projectId is set, we should try to retrieve a project and if none can be found an error should be thrown!
* Separate the logic into 2 web-actions for setting a project's role members and for setting the default project role members.

If this is affecting you, simply go the the Project Role Browser in the admin section and update the default role memberships to stop new projects from having incorrect default role members.
fields.summary: Adding a member to a project role for a deleted project makes this member join the default project role

When navigating to the following URL:

https://<hostname>/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?projectOrFilterId=filter-12770&statistictype=customfield_10000&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting%3Asinglefieldpie-report&Next=Next#dataTable

HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [error] exists for action [ViewIssue]

type Status report

message No view for result [error] exists for action [ViewIssue]

description The requested resource (No view for result [error] exists for action [ViewIssue]) is not available.

Apache Tomcat/5.5.20
==================

on the browser. The issue is correctly created/resolved - it's just that rather than going back to the "View Issue" view, this error appears.

It may be a bug Chrome of course. In that case it may be a good idea for Atlassian to narrow it down and report it to Google (as I expect Chrome will quickly become a very popular browser).
fields.summary: Error when creating/resolving issue using Chrome as browser on JIRA releases before 3.12

fields.description:
When I "MOVE" an Issue to a new project, you never get a screen asking for required changes to fields of that issues subtask.
On the confirm page you get a warning:
bq. Note: Sub-Tasks associated with this issue will lose data stored in fields not applicable in the target.

However, a Bulk Move operation works differently.
We get a step in the wizard to ask the user to change values of fields that require adjusting.

It would be nice if this was consistent.
fields.summary: Fields not part of the destination form, should be STORED as a comment when moved/bulkmoved NOT lost.

fields.description:
JIRA bundles the FishEye plugin as jira-fisheye-plugin-2.2,jar

But internally is reports itself as version 2.1

{code}
FishEye Plugin
Description: JIRA Fisheye Plugin
Vendor: Atlassian Software Systems
Plugin Version: 2.1
JIRA Versions: 3.12 - 4.0
{code}

The atlassian-plugins.xml got missed

This needs to be fixed the next time round!
fields.summary: FishEye plugin 2.2 bundled in JIRA 3.13 reports itself as being version 2.1

fields.description:
From a customer:

{quote}
The issue selector seems to lack an "order by" criteria. When I go into the issue selector via link issues, it doesn't present column headers to change the default order-by, which appears to be reverse  alphabetical by issue code. 

I don't see any way to configure the issue selector to present a textual search interface without the textual search key being predefined. Imagine if Google worked that way.  To be honest, I find it shocking
given the predefined filter requirement that the issue selector offers neither "search within" (textual) or "refine search" capabilities (more general).  

I'm also a touch dismayed that the issue selector references my "current search" without defining what that is or how it became current (which I'll expect I'll soon figure out, but is not presently jumping out at
me).  
{quote}
fields.summary: Improvements to the Issue Selector

fields.description:

It is also a good preliminary step towards upgrading to v2.4, which has partial optimise.

In my version 3.6.5, I have a subscription to a filter with a column for Links. But it doesn't show the actual links in the email as it does when viewing the filter online. I seem to recall reporting this as an issue, but I cannot locate it.

Anyway, I am reporting it now in 3.13 Beta, but oddly, it seemed to work one day and fail the next. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Links not showing in subscription filter

fields.description:
The project parameter on the Create Or Comment Handler, and other related mail handlers, is only relevant to creating new issues.

If an email comes in with an issue key in the subject, we will add it as a comment to that issue, regardless of what project it is in. We do not just do it for the project specified in the project parameter.

We should update the doco (for all relevant handlers) to say that project is only relevant when there is no issue key in the subject, and as such we are creating a new issue.
fields.summary: Update CreateOrCommentHandler doco to say that "project" parameter only refers to creating an issue

fields.description:
Our Oracle doco says to create a database to store JIRA's info in. An Oracle database is a different concept to a database in other database products. In Oracle, a database is often used to store the data for many applications (each in a different user/schema). It would be overkill in many organisations to have a separate database just for JIRA.

We should change the doco to simply say, "in your Oracle database, create a user ..."
fields.summary: Change Oracle doco to not say to create a new database

fields.description: I could have sworn I'd reported this previously, but I can't find the issue. Anyway, as you can see from the screenshot, there is an underscore between the issue icon and issue type description. I am using ThunderBird email client. In file summary-topleft.vm, see lines 48-49 {noformat} ## This is all one line so that we don't get the bug in IE6 where the whitespace gets an underline #renderIcon(${issueType.getIconUrl()} ${issueType.getNameTranslation($i18n)}) {noformat} I'll update this ticket with more info...
fields.summary: Extra underscore between issue type icon and description in notification e-mails

fields.description: If I add an "Assigned To Me" portlet to my dashboard, it appears to display issues on the dashboard as if "Sorted by:  Priority descending, then Created ascending".  If I click the link labeled "Assigned To Me" in the portlet, I see an Issue Navigator displaying issues with only "Sorted by:  Priority descending".  Not having the issues appear in the same order makes it harder to locate the issue when jumping between the two views.
fields.summary: Link on Assigned to Me portlet uses a different sort order than the portlet itself
